meanings.definition: A majority greater than a simple majority, especially in voting.
meanings.sent1: In order to pass the new rule, we needed a supermajority of votes.
meanings.sent2: The supermajority of senators agreed to the proposed legislation.
meanings.sent3: The supermajority of students voted for pizza as the school lunch every day.
meanings.sent4: Reaching a supermajority in the debate club was like finding a rare gem.
meanings.sent5: The supermajority of flowers in the garden were blooming beautifully.

meanings.definition: A number that is more than half of a total, typically two-thirds or three-fourths.
meanings.sent1: The supermajority of the class chose to go on the field trip.
meanings.sent2: To win the game, the team needed a supermajority of points.
meanings.sent3: The supermajority of cookies in the jar mysteriously disappeared overnight.
meanings.sent4: The supermajority of stars in the sky twinkled brightly on that clear night.
meanings.sent5: Finding a supermajority of seashells on the beach made the walk even more enjoyable.
